articles.title: Floral Baskets Sent to DPRK Embassies
Portrait of Kim Il Sung Hung at Head Office of Mexican Political Party
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Sent to DPRK Embassies 
    Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The Malaysian People's Movement sent a floral basket to the DPRK embassy in Kuala Lumpur on June 16 on the occasion of the 41st anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 The general managers of the Bapamko Company and another company of Indonesia separately sent floral baskets to the DPRK embassy in Jakarta on June 17 and 18.

Reparations to Victims of A-bombs Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Bulgarian President on Relations with DPRK 
    Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Bulgaria has paid attention to developing its relations with the DPRK.
 Bulgarian President Georgi Parvanov said this when receiving credentials from Jo Sung Ju, DPRK ambassador e.p. to Bulgaria, on June 16.    
 The president said the two countries have the traditions of good relations, expressing belief that the bilateral relations would grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples.

articles.title: Korea's Reunification Free from Foreign Interference Supported
articles.content:
Reparations to Victims of A-bombs Demanded in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- 74 lawmakers from the Uri Party and the Democratic Workers' Party of south Korea submitted to the National Assembly a resolution requesting the government to take a positive action for Japan's payment of reparations to the victims of A-bombs, according to the south Korean CBS.
 In the resolution they recalled that the government has not yet settled the issue of reparations to the victims of A-bombs in the south Korea-Japan "agreement," urging it to make possible efforts including renegotiation for a solution to the issue, though belatedly.    
 They also requested the government to make a specific inquiry into the actual condition of the A-bomb victims and their children including their health and take immediate measures to provide them with conditions for their medical treatment and living.

Guarantee of Rights of Part-time Workers Demanded in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification reportedly demanded the authorities ensure the rights of the part-time workers.
 The headquarters in its statement on June 17 said the death of Kim Thae Hwan, chief of the Chungju Regional Branch of the Federation of south Korean Trade Unions, who was active for the rights of the part-time workers and was killed by a truck, was a murder committed by the employers who ignored the vital rights of the irregular workers.    
 Urging a stern punishment of the employers and those concerned who were evading responsibility, the statement demanded the government substantially ensure the three rights of labor of the part-time workers.

President of Philippine Senate to Visit DPRK
    Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- Franklin M. Drillon, president of the Senate of the Philippines, will soon visit the DPRK at the invitation of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.

articles.title: Wise Leadership for Solving Socialist Rural Question
articles.content:
Workers' Meeting Held in S. Korea
    Pyongyang, June 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) and the Federation of south Korean Trade Unions (FKTU) held a national workers' meeting in Chungju on June 18 on the death of Kim Thae Hwan, chief of the Chungju Regional Branch of the FKTU, hit by a truck in the midst of a demonstration, according to the south Korean KBS.
 Present at the meeting were delegates of at least 100 labor and civic and public organizations, including Chairman of the KCTU Ri Su Ho and Chairman of the FKTU Ri Yong Duk, and over 6,000 unionists of the two labor organizations.    
 The participants demanded the government authorities thoroughly probe into the truth behind the incident and take immediate measures for the problem of the employed workers.
